result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome J Wesa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 6 months if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: Perform 30 hours of uncompensated community service for a non-profit agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome J Wesa

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for 1 year to pay Court-ordered financial obligations

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jerome J Wesa in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Jerome J Wesa in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has not met with Mr. Wesa. Court reviews previous activity. Defendant doesn't know what he was supposed to do. State advises that updated AODA assessment and recommendation must be completed, was to have been done by today. Defendant wasn't told, was not aware. Court advises Defendant to speak with Atty Gerbers. Defendant doesn't have money to pay for another assessment. State has given Mr. Gerbers an alternative option.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jerome J Wesa in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant has not completed requirements requested by DA's office, requests 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.
No contact direct or indirect with BT or BT's residence. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Jerome J Wesa in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense enters not guilty plea, requests status in 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of medical issues of Defendant, requests that case be rescheduled in about a month.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court advises of call from Defendant that he is hospital having surgery. If medical reasons prevent him from appearing, new date can be requested.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
